lead_paragraph: More than 500,000 individual taxpayers took advantage of the same tax rule as Mr. Trump in 1995. Their average loss: just $97,600.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

headline.print_headline: How a Simple Tax Rule Helped Trump Turn a Huge Loss Into a Plus
headline.main: How a Simple Tax Rule Let Donald Trump Turn a $916 Million Loss Into a Plus

snippet: More than 500,000 individual taxpayers took advantage of the same tax rule as Mr. Trump in 1995. Their average loss: just $97,600....
abstract: Tax documents obtained by The New York Times about Donald Trump's finances in 1995 show that he claimed almost billion dollars in operating losses in order to avoid future federal income taxation; while maneuver is relatively uncontroversial and was employed by over 500,000 individual taxpayers in 1995, amount Trump claimed was far higher than average loss of $97,600.
